# Axis
#### [*](#) , [..](#) , [siblings](#) , [descendant](#) , [descendant-or-self](#) , [ancestor](#) , [ancestor-or-self](#) , [//](#) , [self](#) , [parent](#)
Axis expressions are used to navigate around the node tree to retrieve a node set relative to the current node

JSXOperatorTokens.name: JSXOperatorTokens
JSXOperatorTokens.description:
JSXPath
=======
- [Home](../README.html)
- [Axis](AXIS.html)
- [Functions](FUNCTIONS.html)
- [Node Selection](NODESELECTION.html)
- Operators

# Operators 
##### [+](#+) , [-](#-2) , [*](#-3) , [div](#div) , [mod](#mod) , [=](#-4) , [!=](#-5) , [>](#gt) , [<](#lt) , [>=](#gt-2) , [<=](#lt-2) , [and](#and) , [or](#or) , [|](#-6)
Operators are symbols used to perform operation/tests on its left and right values.

The following operator examples will use the JSXPath constructor below as the initial setup.
```js
var JSXPath = require("JSXPath");
var js = {
	a: 1,
	b: 2,
	c: [3, 4]
};
var jsxpath = new JSXPath(js); 
```

JSXPathFunctions.name: JSXPathFunctions
JSXPathFunctions.description:
JSXPath 
=======
- [Home](../README.html)
- [Axis](AXIS.html)
- Functions
- [Node Selection](NODESELECTION.html)
- [Operators](OPERATORS.html)

# Functions
[node]() , 
[nodeValue]() , 
[text]()


Function expression are used to refine queries or add programming capabilities. JSXPath allows user to add their own custom functions (see TODO)

The following function examples will use the JSXPath constructor below as the initial setup.
##### constructor
```js
var js = {
	int: {
		a: 1,
		b: 2
	},
	dec: {
		a: 1.5,
		b: 1.4
	}
	str: {
		st1: "abc",
		st2: "DE",
		st3: "efg",
		tok: "q,u,a,n,g",
		num: "-10"
	}
}
var jsxpath = new JSXPath(js);
```

JSXPath.name: JSXPath

classitems.description: explode the input json
Converts function name and axes name containing dashes to Camel Case if any;

return.description: camelcased function name and axes path expressions

classitems.name: replace
classitems.description: Performs a series of predefined string replacement of the path expression.

classitems.name: _op1
classitems.description: Replace function for ">=|<=|>|<|\||*|=|!=|+|"

classitems.name: _op2
classitems.description: Replace function for "and|or|div|mod" operators.

classitems.name: _objectKey
classitems.description: Replace function for node name expressions in quotes

params.name: poVariables
params.description: An object containing the defined variables.

params.name: poKeys
params.description: The list of keys from the input json.

classitems.name: _axis

params.description: An object containing the defined variables.

classitems.name: _position
classitems.description: Replace function for position expression

classitems.name: _descendant
classitems.description: Replace function for "//".

classitems.name: _object
classitems.description: Replace function for pure object or array expression.

params.description: An object containing the defined variables.

classitems.name: _test
classitems.description: Function to parse a predicates.

params.name: exploded
params.description: Flattened/exploded form of the initial json

classitems.description: Function to determine what type of element is in the parsed array.

## ancestor
retrieves all ancestors of current node excluding self
classitems.name: ancestor

classitems.description:
## ancestor-or-self
retrieves the ancestors of current node including self

classitems.description:
## //
retrieves the parent node
alias: [descendant-or-self](#)

## self
current node
alias: [descendant-or-self](#)

retrieves the parent node

classitems.description:
## !=
not equal

```js
let path = '/a != /b'
let result = jsxpath.process(path);
----------
// result => true
```

return.description: A function that accepts the next parsed value argument

A function that accepts the next parsed value argument

classitems.description:
## and
logical and

```js
let path = '/a and /b'
let result = jsxpath.process(path)
----------
// result => [1, 2]
```
